forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 53. West wind around 21 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

forecast.name: Independence Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 18 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph.

weather_report:
As the city of San Francisco sleeps beneath a blanket of scattered clouds, the air is cool, invigorated by a west wind that whispers through the night. With temperatures resting at a mild 53 degrees, the scene is set for a day awash with sunshine, although the charm of the iconic fog is never too far away. As the sun ascends, a bright warmth is destined to replace the coolness—a glorious Independence Day showcasing a lofty high around 62. Yet, later in the day, as the horizon bends toward evening, we can expect temperatures to gently retreat to a pleasant 60 degrees, enveloping the city in a light, soothing embrace.

Tomorrow’s whispers of wind will be felt prominently, gusting to nearly 35 mph, and those venturing out would do well to don layers, perhaps a light jacket or sweater, to complement their favorite summer attire amid the breezy conditions. Today holds an invitation to stroll amongst the city’s vibrant neighborhoods or to partake in a leisurely picnic in one of its lush parks, where friends and families can gather and celebrate. The clarity of the day, however bright, may yield to hints of that familiar marine layer drifting in, softly reminding us of the ever-present dance between sun and fog that defines this remarkable coast.
